intro: Syrmatium nevadense, commonly known as the Nevada syrmatium, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of Nevada. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It has a low, sprawling growth habit with gray-green foliage adapted to withstand drought. Syrmatium nevadense is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to desert environments.
